content: More specifically, in November of this year, we declared a cash dividend of $0.175 per common share, or approximately US$17.3 million in aggregate for the third quarter of 2022 and a special stock distribution of all shares â Series D Convertible Preferred Shares of OceanPal Inc. held by the company. In February 2023, the company signed a memorandum of agreement for the sale of Melia, for an aggregate price of US$14 million to OceanPal Inc., the amount of US$4 million was paid in cash upon signing of the memorandum of agreement and the remaining amount was paid upon the delivery of the vessel in the form of 13,157 Series D Convertible Preferred Shares issued by OceanPal. Lastly, as of February, 16, we have secured 68% of the remaining ownership days of 2023, securing approximately US$169.2 million of contracted revenues and have also secured approximately US$39.5 million of contracted revenues or 14% of the available ownership days for the entire year of 2024. Our time charter revenues for the fourth quarter of 2022 amounted to US$75.7 million, as against US$68.8 million for the same period of 2021. We also have charted one Kamsarmax, four Panamaxes and three post-Panamax vessels at a weighted average daily rate of US$14,350 and for a remaining average period of 296 days per vessel.
